intro: Cryptangium dracaenula, commonly known as the dwarf dracaena, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its compact, upright growth habit. The plant features narrow, dark green leaves that are often variegated with white or yellow markings. It produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that appear in clusters during the spring. Cryptangium dracaenula is well-suited for indoor cultivation due to its low maintenance requirements and ability to thrive in low-light conditions.
